text.title: Jail Berlusconi, says prosecutor

main.p: A prosecutor yesterday called for Silvio Berlusconi to be given an eight-year jail sentence as his four-year trial for allegedly bribing judges neared culmination.

Winding up the case for the state in the latest of the prime minister's several corruption trials, Ilda Boccassini told a Milan court room his business group Fininvest had had judges "on their payroll ... so that they served the interests of Berlusconi".
Her proposed sentence prompted an outraged reaction from the prime minister's supporters.
"This request is the death of justice," declared Sandro Bondi, national co-ordinator of Mr Berlusconi's Forza Italia party.
In the Milan trial Mr Berlusconi is charged with giving money to his lawyer to bribe judges in Rome so as to secure the purchase of a state-owned food conglomerate.
The alleged offence took place several years before he entered politics.
A verdict is expected around the end of the year.
